Simulation Context¶

Overview¶

Manages the simulation setup, including configuration loading and dynamic selection of the physics model.

Examples¶

>>> from src.core.simulation_context import *

API Summary¶

src.core.simulation_context

Manages the simulation setup, including configuration loading and dynamic selection of the physics model.

Detailed API¶

Manages the simulation setup, including configuration loading and dynamic selection of the physics model.

class src.core.simulation_context.SimulationContext(config_path='config.yaml')[source]¶

Bases: object

Initializes and holds the context for a simulation run.

This class centralizes the setup logic by loading the configuration and selecting the appropriate dynamics model based on that config.

Parameters:

config_path (str)

__init__(config_path='config.yaml')[source]¶

Initialize the simulation context by loading the configuration.

Parameters:

config_path (str)

get_dynamics_model()[source]¶

Return the initialized dynamics model.

Return type:

DoubleInvertedPendulum | FullDIPDynamics

get_config()[source]¶

Return the validated configuration model for reuse by callers.

Return type:

ConfigSchema

create_controller(name=None, gains=None)[source]¶

Create a controller using the shared, validated config and the project factory. If no name is provided, default to ‘classical_smc’. If no gains are provided, use defaults from config.

Parameters:

  • name (str | None)

  • gains (List[float] | None)

Return type:

Any

create_fdi()[source]¶

Create the FDI system if enabled in config; otherwise return None. Mirrors the previous app-level behavior (non-fatal if missing).

Return type:

Any | None
